Class ClientSide.Session

java.lang.Object
ClientSide.Session
Enclosing class:
ClientSide
public class ClientSide.Session extends Object
Manages user session details including the current user's information and a unique communication ID. This class is responsible for handling the user's login status and session-specific identifiers that facilitate communication identification among other clients with a server.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Session()
    Constructs a Session object with a randomly generated communication ID.

  • Constructor Details

    • Session

      public Session()
      Constructs a Session object with a randomly generated communication ID. The communication ID is used to uniquely identify the session in network communications.

  • Method Details

    • setCurrentUser

      public void setCurrentUser(ClientSide.User user)
      Sets the current user of the session. This method updates the session's user information.
      Parameters:
      user - the User object representing the logged-in user.

    • getCurrentUser

      public ClientSide.User getCurrentUser()
      Returns the currently logged-in user. This method retrieves the user information stored in the session.
      Returns:
      the current user as a User object. If no user is logged in, this will return null.

    • getCommunicationID

      public int getCommunicationID()
      Retrieves the communication ID of the session. The communication ID is used to identify the session uniquely across different network messages.
      Returns:
      the communication ID as an integer.
